title: ISC2 CISSP Practice Questions
description: Practice questions for CISSP certification exam preparation

questions.question: Physical assets defined in an organization's business impact analysis (BIA) could include which of the following?
options: Personal belongings of organizational staff members
Supplies kept off-site at a remote facility
questions.explanation: Physical assets in a BIA include tangible items that the organization owns or controls for business operations. Supplies kept off-site at a remote facility are physical assets that could be impacted during a disaster.

questions.question: When assessing the audit capability of an application, which of the following activities is MOST important?
options: Identify procedures to investigate suspicious activity
Determine if audit records contain sufficient information
Verify if sufficient storage is allocated for audit records
Review security plan for actions to be taken in the event of audit failure
questions.explanation: The most critical aspect is ensuring audit records contain sufficient information to be useful for security investigations and compliance. Without adequate information in the logs, other audit capabilities become less effective.

questions.question: An organization would like to implement an authorization mechanism that would simplify the assignment of various system access permissions for many users with similar job responsibilities. Which type of authorization mechanism would be the BEST choice for the organization to implement?
questions.explanation: RBAC is specifically designed to simplify permission management by assigning permissions to roles rather than individual users. Users with similar job responsibilities can be assigned to the same role, greatly simplifying administration.

questions.question: What is the PRIMARY reason for criminal law being difficult to enforce when dealing with cybercrime?
questions.explanation: Cybercrime often crosses international borders, making it difficult to determine which country's laws apply and which law enforcement agency has jurisdiction. This is the primary challenge in enforcing criminal law for cybercrimes.

questions.question: Wi-Fi Protected Access 2 (WPA2) provides users with a higher level of assurance that their data will remain protected by using which protocol?
questions.explanation: WPA2 uses EAP for authentication, which provides a framework for various authentication methods. EAP allows for stronger authentication mechanisms compared to the original WPA.

questions.question: Which part of an operating system (OS) is responsible for providing security interfaces among the hardware, OS, and other parts of the computing system?
questions.explanation: The security kernel is the central part of the TCB that mediates all access between subjects and objects. It enforces the security policy and provides the security interfaces among hardware, OS, and other system components.

questions.question: What process facilitates the balance of operational and economic costs of protective measures with gains in mission capability?
questions.explanation: Risk management is the comprehensive process that balances the costs of security controls against the benefits they provide. It helps organizations make informed decisions about which protective measures to implement based on cost-benefit analysis.

questions.question: Clothing retailer employees are provisioned with user accounts that provide access to resources at partner businesses. All partner businesses use common identity and access management (IAM) protocols and differing technologies. Under the Extended Identity principle, what is the process flow between partner businesses to allow this IAM action?
options: Clothing retailer acts as User Self Service, confirms identity of user using industry standards, then sends credentials to partner businesses that act as a Service Provider and allows access to services

Clothing retailer acts as identity provider (IdP), confirms identity of user using industry standards, then sends credentials to partner businesses that act as a Service Provider and allows access to services

Clothing retailer acts as Service Provider, confirms identity of user using industry standards, then sends credentials to partner businesses that act as an identity provider (IdP) and allows access to resources

Clothing retailer acts as Access Control Provider, confirms access of user using industry standards, then sends credentials to partner businesses that act as a Service Provider and allows access to resources
questions.explanation: In federated identity management, the clothing retailer acts as the Identity Provider (IdP) that authenticates its employees and provides identity assertions to partner businesses (Service Providers) who then grant access to their resources.

questions.question: Which of the following statements BEST describes least privilege principle in a cloud environment?
options: A single cloud administrator is configured to access core functions
Internet traffic is inspected for all incoming and outgoing packets
Routing configurations are regularly updated with the latest routes
Network segments remain private if unneeded to access the internet
questions.explanation: Least privilege in cloud environments means granting only the minimum necessary access. Keeping network segments private unless internet access is needed exemplifies this principle by minimizing unnecessary exposure.

questions.question: An organization has been collecting a large amount of redundant and unusable data and filling up the storage area network (SAN). Management has requested the identification of a solution that will address ongoing storage problems. Which is the BEST technical solution?
questions.explanation: Deduplication identifies and eliminates redundant data, storing only unique instances. This is the best solution for addressing redundant data filling up storage, as it specifically targets duplicate information.

questions.question: Which Wide Area Network (WAN) technology requires the first router in the path to determine the full path the packet will travel, removing the need for other routers in the path to make independent determinations?
questions.explanation: MPLS uses label-switched paths where the ingress router determines the complete path through the network. Subsequent routers simply forward packets based on the MPLS label without making routing decisions.

questions.question: Which of the following would an information security professional use to recognize changes to content, particularly unauthorized changes?
options: Security information and event management (SIEM) system
questions.explanation: File Integrity Checkers (like Tripwire) create baselines of file checksums and monitor for any changes. This is the most direct and effective method for detecting unauthorized file modifications.

questions.question: Which of the following is included in change management?
questions.explanation: UAT before implementation is a critical component of change management. It ensures changes work as expected and meet user requirements before being deployed to production.

questions.question: A company is enrolled in a hard drive reuse program where decommissioned equipment is sold back to the vendor when it is no longer needed. The vendor pays more money for functioning drives than equipment that is no longer operational. Which method of data sanitization would provide the most secure means of preventing unauthorized data loss, while also receiving the most money from the vendor?
questions.explanation: Multi-pass wipes provide secure data sanitization while keeping the drive functional for resale. This balances security with maximizing return value, as the drive remains operational unlike with degaussing or physical destruction.

questions.question: When reviewing vendor certifications for handling and processing of company data, which of the following is the BEST Service Organization Controls (SOC) certification for the vendor to possess?
questions.explanation: SOC 2 Type 2 is the most comprehensive certification, covering security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy over a period of time (Type 2), not just at a point in time (Type 1).

questions.question: Which application type is considered high risk and provides a common way for malware and viruses to enter a network?
questions.explanation: P2P file sharing applications are considered highest risk because they allow direct connections between users, often bypassing security controls, and commonly distribute files that may contain malware.

questions.question: An organization is looking to include mobile devices in its asset management system for better tracking. In which system tier of the reference architecture would mobile devices be tracked?
questions.explanation: In reference architectures, Tier 1 typically represents client devices including mobile devices, workstations, and laptops that users directly interact with.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST way to protect an organization's data assets?
options: Encrypt data in transit and at rest using up-to-date cryptographic algorithms
Monitor and enforce adherence to security policies
Require Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and Separation of Duties (SoD)
Create the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) with proxies, firewalls and hardened bastion hosts
questions.explanation: While all options provide security benefits, monitoring and enforcing adherence to security policies is the most comprehensive approach as it encompasses all security controls and ensures they are properly implemented and maintained.

questions.question: Within a large organization, what business unit is BEST positioned to initiate provisioning and deprovisioning of user accounts?
questions.explanation: Human Resources is best positioned as they manage employee lifecycle events (hiring, transfers, terminations) that trigger account provisioning and deprovisioning. They have the authoritative information about personnel changes.

questions.question: Which of the following is the PRIMARY purpose of installing a mantrap within a facility?
questions.explanation: A mantrap is specifically designed to prevent piggybacking (tailgating) by ensuring only one authenticated person can pass through at a time. It consists of two interlocking doors that prevent multiple people from entering together.

questions.question: In the 'Do' phase of the Plan-Do-Check-Act model, which of the following is performed?
options: Maintain and improve the Business Continuity Management (BCM) system by taking corrective action, based on the results of management review
Monitor and review performance against business continuity policy and objectives, report the results to management for review, and determine and authorize actions for remediation and improvement
Ensure the business continuity policy, controls, processes, and procedures have been implemented
Ensure that business continuity policy, objectives, targets, controls, processes and procedures relevant to improving business continuity have been established
questions.explanation: The 'Do' phase is about implementing what was planned. This includes ensuring policies, controls, processes, and procedures are actually put into action.

questions.question: What industry-recognized document could be used as a baseline reference that is related to data security and business operations or conducting a security assessment?
questions.explanation: SOC 2 Type 1 provides a baseline reference for security assessments as it evaluates security controls at a specific point in time, making it suitable as a baseline reference document.

questions.question: A criminal organization is planning an attack on a government network. Which of the following scenarios presents the HIGHEST risk to the organization?
options: Organization loses control of their network devices
Network is flooded with communication traffic by the attacker
Attacker accesses sensitive information regarding the network topology
questions.explanation: Losing control of network devices represents the highest risk as it gives attackers complete control over the infrastructure, allowing them to conduct any malicious activity, steal data, or cause severe disruption.

questions.question: Which reporting type requires a service organization to describe its system and define its control objectives and controls that are relevant to users' internal control over financial reporting?
questions.explanation: SOC 1 reports specifically focus on controls relevant to financial reporting, making them essential for organizations that provide services affecting their clients' financial statements.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST method to validate secure coding techniques against injection and overflow attacks?
options: Scheduled team review of coding style and techniques for vulnerability patterns
The regular use of production code routines from similar applications already in use
Using automated programs to test for the latest known vulnerability patterns
Ensure code editing tools are updated against known vulnerability patterns
questions.explanation: Automated security testing tools can continuously scan code for known vulnerability patterns including injection and overflow attacks, providing comprehensive and up-to-date detection.

questions.question: When resolving ethical conflicts, the information security professional MUST consider many factors. In what order should the considerations be prioritized?
options: Public safety, duties to individuals, duties to the profession, and duties to principals
Public safety, duties to principals, duties to the profession, and duties to individuals
Public safety, duties to principals, duties to individuals, and duties to the profession
Public safety, duties to the profession, duties to principals, and duties to individuals
questions.explanation: The (ISC)Â² Code of Ethics prioritizes: 1) Public safety first, 2) Duties to principals (employer/client), 3) Duties to individuals, and 4) Duties to the profession.

questions.question: Which service management process BEST helps information technology (IT) organizations with reducing cost, mitigating risk, and improving customer service?
questions.explanation: ITIL is the most comprehensive framework for IT service management, providing best practices for reducing costs, mitigating risks, and improving customer service across all IT operations.

questions.question: A company is attempting to enhance the security of its user authentication processes. After evaluating several options, the company has decided to utilize Identity as a Service (IDaaS). Which of the following factors leads the company to choose an IDaaS as their solution?
options: In-house team lacks resources to support an on-premise solution
Third-party solutions are inherently more secure
Third-party solutions are known for transferring the risk to the vendor
questions.explanation: Organizations typically choose IDaaS when they lack the resources (staff, expertise, or infrastructure) to implement and maintain an on-premise identity management solution.

questions.question: An organization recently suffered from a web-application attack that resulted in stolen user session cookie information. The attacker was able to obtain the information when a user's browser executed a script upon visiting a compromised website. What type of attack MOST likely occurred?
questions.explanation: XSS attacks inject malicious scripts into web applications that execute in users' browsers, allowing attackers to steal session cookies and other sensitive information.

questions.question: An attack utilizing social engineering and a malicious Uniform Resource Locator (URL) link to take advantage of a victim's existing browser session with a web application is an example of which of the following types of attack?
questions.explanation: CSRF attacks exploit authenticated sessions by tricking users into clicking malicious links that perform unwanted actions using the victim's existing session credentials.

questions.question: Which of the following encryption technologies has the ability to function as a stream cipher?
options: Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) with error propagation
questions.explanation: CFB (Cipher Feedback) mode can operate as a stream cipher by encrypting data bit-by-bit or byte-by-byte, rather than in fixed-size blocks.

questions.question: In a disaster recovery (DR) test, which of the following would be a trait of crisis management?
questions.explanation: Crisis management involves anticipating potential crises and preparing responses. The ability to anticipate problems before they occur is a key trait of effective crisis management.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes the purpose of the reference monitor when defining access control to enforce the security model?
options: Strong operational security to keep unit members safe
Cyber hygiene to ensure organizations can keep systems healthy
Quality design principles to ensure quality by design
questions.explanation: The reference monitor enforces access control policies that validate and enforce organizational security rules, ensuring all access requests comply with the security model.

questions.question: Which of the following is security control volatility?
options: A reference to the impact of the security control
A reference to the likelihood of change in the security control
A reference to how unpredictable the security control is
A reference to the stability of the security control
questions.explanation: Security control volatility refers to how likely a control is to change over time, which affects planning and maintenance of security systems.

questions.question: When auditing the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) which of the following is one of the high-level audit phases?
questions.explanation: Planning is a high-level audit phase in SDLC auditing, establishing the scope, objectives, and approach for the audit.

questions.question: What is the term used to define where data is geographically stored in the cloud?
questions.explanation: Data sovereignty refers to the concept that data is subject to the laws and governance of the country where it is physically stored.

questions.question: Which of the following does the security design process ensure within the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC)?
options: Proper security controls, security objectives, and security goals are properly initiated
Security objectives, security goals, and system test are properly conducted
Proper security controls, security goals, and fault mitigation are properly conducted
Security goals, proper security controls, and validation are properly initiated
questions.explanation: The security design process in SDLC ensures that security controls, objectives, and goals are properly initiated and integrated from the beginning of the development process.

questions.question: Which of the following is MOST important to follow when developing information security controls for an organization?
options: Use industry standard best practices for security controls in the organization
Exercise due diligence with regard to all risk management information to tailor appropriate controls
Review all local and international standards and choose the most stringent based on location
Perform a risk assessment and choose a standard that addresses existing gaps
questions.explanation: Due diligence in risk management ensures controls are appropriately tailored to the organization's specific risk profile, rather than applying generic solutions.

questions.question: When recovering from an outage, what is the Recovery Point Objective (RPO), in terms of data recovery?
options: The RPO is the minimum amount of data that needs to be recovered
The RPO is the amount of time it takes to recover an acceptable percentage of data lost
The RPO is a goal to recover a targeted percentage of data lost
The RPO is the maximum amount of time for which loss of data is acceptable
questions.explanation: RPO defines the maximum acceptable age of files that must be recovered from backup storage for normal operations to resume. It represents the maximum tolerable data loss measured in time.

questions.question: Which of the following attacks, if successful, could give an intruder complete control of a software-defined networking (SDN) architecture?
options: A brute force password attack on the Secure Shell (SSH) port of the controller
Sending control messages to open a flow that does not pass a firewall from a compromised host within the network
Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS) token replay attack
Sniffing the traffic of a compromised host inside the network
questions.explanation: In SDN, the controller manages the entire network. Successfully attacking the controller via SSH would give complete control over the SDN architecture.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST option to reduce the network attack surface of a system?
options: Ensuring that there are no group accounts on the system
Uninstalling default software on the system
questions.explanation: Disabling unnecessary ports and services directly reduces the network attack surface by eliminating potential entry points for attackers.

questions.question: The security architect is designing and implementing an internal certification authority to generate digital certificates for all employees. Which of the following is the BEST solution to securely store the private keys?
questions.explanation: TPM is a hardware-based security module that provides secure storage for cryptographic keys and is tamper-resistant, making it the best solution for storing private keys.

questions.question: The existence of physical barriers, card and personal identification number (PIN) access systems, cameras, alarms, and security guards BEST describes this security approach?
questions.explanation: Defense-in-depth uses multiple layers of security controls (physical, technical, and administrative) to protect assets, as described in the question.

questions.question: A hospital enforces the Code of Fair Information Practices. What practice applies to a patient requesting their medical records from a web portal?
questions.explanation: Individual participation allows individuals to access their own data and verify its accuracy, which applies to patients requesting their medical records.

questions.question: A colleague who recently left the organization asked a security professional for a copy of the organization's confidential incident management policy. Which of the following is the BEST response to this request?
options: Access the policy on a company-issued device and let the former colleague view the screen
E-mail the policy to the colleague as they were already part of the organization and familiar with it
Do not acknowledge receiving the request from the former colleague and ignore them
Submit the request using company official channels to ensure the policy is okay to distribute
questions.explanation: Following proper channels ensures the request is evaluated by appropriate authorities who can determine if the former employee has legitimate need and authorization for the confidential policy.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes when an organization should conduct a black box security audit on a new software project?
options: When the organization wishes to check for non-functional compliance
When the organization wants to enumerate known security vulnerabilities across their infrastructure
When the organization is confident the final source code is complete
When the organization has experienced a security incident
questions.explanation: Black box testing should be conducted when the code is complete to test the application from an external attacker's perspective without knowledge of internal workings.

questions.question: In software development, which of the following entities normally signs the code to protect the code integrity?
questions.explanation: The organization developing the code typically signs it with a digital certificate to verify its authenticity and integrity, establishing trust with users.

questions.question: Which of the following technologies can be used to monitor and dynamically respond to potential threats on web applications?
questions.explanation: RASP integrates into applications and monitors their behavior in real-time, allowing it to detect and respond to attacks dynamically as they occur.

questions.question: A security architect is developing an information system for a client. One of the requirements is to deliver a platform that mitigates against common vulnerabilities and attacks. What is the MOST efficient option used to prevent buffer overflow attacks?
questions.explanation: ASLR randomizes memory addresses, making it difficult for attackers to predict where to inject malicious code, effectively preventing many buffer overflow exploits.

questions.question: In a quarterly system access review, an active privileged account was discovered that did not exist in the prior review on the production system. The account was created one hour after the previous access review. Which of the following is the BEST option to reduce overall risk in addition to quarterly access reviews?
questions.explanation: Risk-based alerts can detect anomalous privileged account creation in real-time, providing immediate notification rather than waiting for the next quarterly review.
